intro: Hieracium pilosella var. incanum, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows in grasslands, meadows, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. The plant features bright yellow flowers that bloom from June to August, arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. Its leaves are hairy and lance-shaped, and the stems are also covered in fine hairs. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement.
